sen.j: 正二位（しょうにい）は、日本の位階及び神階における位の一つ。
sen.e: Shonii (Senior Second Rank) is one of the ranks in Ikai (court ranks) and Shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.
Shonii (Senior Second Rank) is one of the ranks in Ikai (court ranks) and Shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.
Shonii (Senior Second Rank) is one of the ranks in Ikai (court ranks) and Shinkai (ranks granted to Shinto gods) in Japan.

sen.j: 従一位の下、従二位の上に位する。
sen.e: This rank is lower than Juichii (Junior First Rank) and upper than Junii (Junior Second Rank).
This rank is lower than Juichii (Junior First Rank) and upper than Junii (Junior Second Rank).
This rank is lower than Juichii (Junior First Rank) and upper than Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 律令制における官位相当においては左大臣、右大臣に相当する。
sen.e: This rank is the equivalent of Sadaijin (minister of the left) and Udaijin (minister of the right) in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: This rank is the equivalent of Sadaijin (minister of the left) and Udaijin (minister of the right) in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
This rank is the equivalent of Sadaijin (minister of the left) and Udaijin (minister of the right) in the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: 室町幕府、江戸幕府の征夷大将軍もその在職中、この位階に留まることが多い。
sen.e: Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in Muromachi bakufu and Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal governments headed by a shogun) often stayed in this rank during their tenure as Seii taishogun.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in Muromachi bakufu and Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal governments headed by a shogun) often stayed in this rank during their tenure as Seii taishogun.

Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians") in Muromachi bakufu and Edo bakufu (Japanese feudal governments headed by a shogun) often stayed in this rank during their tenure as Seii taishogun.

sen.j: その他、大納言、中納言など大臣に昇ることがない羽林家未満の公卿も昇叙によってこの位階に叙せられることがある。
sen.e: Also, Kugyo (the top court officials) who did not rise to a minister and who were lower than the Urin family (the fourth highest family status for court nobles), including Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), were promoted to this rank.

Also, Kugyo (the top court officials) who did not rise to a minister and who were lower in rank than the Urin family (the fourth highest family status for court nobles), including Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), were promoted to this rank.
sen.cmt: lowerの後に in rankを追加、
sen.e: Also, Kugyo (the top court officials) who did not rise to a minister and who were lower in rank than the Urin family (the fourth highest family status for court nobles), including Dainagon (chief councilor of state) and Chunagon (vice-councilor of state), were promoted to this rank.

sen.j: 勲等においては、大勲位ないし勲一等と相当した。
sen.e: In the Order of Merit, this rank was the equivalent of the Supreme Order or the First Order of Merit.
In the Order of Merit, this rank was the equivalent of the Supreme Order or the First Order of Merit.
In the Order of Merit, this rank was the equivalent of the Supreme Order or the First Order of Merit.

sen.j: 平安時代から幕末にかけて正二位に叙せられた者のうち、贈位により正二位を受けた場合、その位階は贈正二位と表記される。
sen.e: Regarding people who were conferred Shonii from the Heian period to the end of Edo period, when they were conferred Shonii as a posthumous rank, their Ikai was written as Shonii, posthumously conferred.
sen.cmt: 以下の訳と迷いました。In the case of people who were conferred Shonii as a posthumous rank from the Heian period to the end of Edo period, their Ikai was written as Shonii, posthumously conferred.
sen.e: In the case of people who were conferred Shonii upon as a posthumous rank from the Heian period to the end of Edo period, their Ikai (Court rank) was written as "Shonii, posthumously conferred."
sen.cmt: who were conferred Shonii を who were conferred Shonii upon に変更（upon追記）, Ikaiの説明として(Court rank)を追記、Shonii, posthumously conferred引用符で囲みました。
sen.e: In the case of people who were conferred Shonii upon as a posthumous rank from the Heian period to the end of Edo period, their Ikai (Court rank) was written as "Shonii, posthumously conferred."

sen.j: 明治時代から終戦前の時代にあっては、親任官他、勅任官及び華族が叙せられる位階であった。
sen.e: From the Meji Period to the time before the end of war, this rank was conferred on an official appointed by the emperor, an imperial appointee as well as the peerage.
From the Meji Period to the end of the Second World War, this rank was conferred on such people as an official appointed by the emperor, an imperial appointee as well as the peerage.
sen.cmt: 表現の見直しをしました。
sen.e: From the Meji Period to the end of the Second World War, this rank was conferred on such people as an official appointed by the emperor, an imperial appointee as well as the peerage.

sen.j: 日本国憲法に規定される栄典としての位階は死没時に叙位されるため、内閣総理大臣など三権の長として功労ある者が死後に受けることが多い。
sen.e: Since Ikai (conferred) as an honor which is stipulated in the Constitution of Japan is conferred posthumously, it is usually conferred on Sanken-no-cho (chiefs of three organization of powers) who have rendered distinguished services, such as a prime minister, after their death.

Since Ikai as an honor stipulated in the Constitution of Japan is conferred posthumously, it is usually conferred on Sanken-no-cho (chiefs of three organization of powers), who rendered distinguished services such as a prime minister, after their death.
sen.cmt: 表現の見直しをしました。
sen.e: Since Ikai as an honor stipulated in the Constitution of Japan is conferred posthumously, it is usually conferred on Sanken-no-cho (chiefs of three organization of powers), who rendered distinguished services such as a prime minister, after their death.

tit.j: 正二位に叙された人物

sen.e: The date is a conferral date.
The date is a conferral date.
The date is a conferral date.

sen.j: 没時追賜の場合は直前の位階を参考付記。
sen.e: In the case of a posthumous conferral, an antemortem Ikai is additionally indicated for reference.
In the case of a posthumous conferral, an antemortem Ikai is additionally indicated for reference.
In the case of a posthumous conferral, an antemortem Ikai is additionally indicated for reference.

tit.e: After the effectuation of the Constitution of Japan
After the effectuation of the Constitution of Japan
After the effectuation of the Constitution of Japan

sen.e: The following are all posthumous conferrals.
sen.cmt: 「いずれも没時追賜。」を、下にリストがあることが前提で訳してみましたが、「All posthumous conferrals」又は「Posthumous conferraｌ」だけでもいいかもしれません。
sen.e: The following are all posthumous conferrals.
The following are all posthumous conferrals.
